EWA A106
  • IMPRESSIVE VOLUME AND BASS - A106 mini speaker is conveniently small but able to releasing crystal clear sound with impressive bass and room-filling loudness through a high-performance driver and a passive subwoofer. Small, but such powerful Bluetooth speakers. Wireless streaming music or internet radio services such as Pandora and Spotify from your Smartphone, iPhone, or other audio device with Bluetooth.
  • EASY TO CARRY - weighing6.2 ounces and measuring1.89*H1.54 inches, along with the speaker, you will get a metal hook and a carrying case which allows you to take your music on the go, and also protect your EWA A106 portable speaker from damage. So it is perfect for outdoor, hiking, beach, dorm room, kitchen, bathroom, boat, golf car and more.
  • LONG BATTERY LIFE - the built-in rechargeable battery guarantees 5 hours of play time, and up to 8 hours at 50% volume. Just half an hour of charge time with 1A charger equals 3 Hours of play time.
  • SIMPLE YET STYLISH DESIGN - our vision was to make a small wireless speakers with bluetooth that is just a speaker, so you can use it anytime, anywhere. We gave up functions such as a microphone, 3.5mm jack and unnecessary buttons, leaving one silicone button (Hold to switch on/ off, one-tap to pause, double-tap or triple-tap to switch songs), a perfect gift.

Product description

EWA A106Pro Super Mini Portable Bluetooth Speaker

Egg-sized, delicate, premium and innovative. The EWA A106Pro Bluetooth speaker has been designed to fit in everywhere.

About EWA

Since 2011, the EWA brand was established by the spirits of "Beyond the Limits".

As a designer and manufacturer, we focus on portable wireless speakers and earbuds, to develop premium and valuable products for people. We believe that the most important thing for audio products is the sound, which is why we spent so much time perfecting the sound quality of this stunning model.

Never settle, we are always on the way to break the limits.

Small, Until You Hear it.

Making Moments Special

From the begining, we were thinking of making such a speaker:

It should be small, so it can be taken and enjoyed anywhere.

So, we defined the size as 1.89* 1.57'', just like an egg. It was originally packed with a hard EVA case to allow the speaker to play music when inside and to protect the speaker from scratches.

It should sounds beyond the limit of the size.

So, we equipped the speaker with a custom-made, high performance 3W neodymium driver, which delivers a loud (for its size) and balanced sound.

It should have bass.

Previously, the biggest pain point of small size speakers was the weakness of the bass performance. In such a tiny space, we needed to add the driver, the battery and all electronic components inside. Besides, through our innovative technology, the EWA A106Pro speaker was equipped with a passive radiator, which is why it released bass, this needed to fit too.

It should be simple and delicate.

People like something that is small and delicate, so we used metal materials, and followed a minimalism design.

People do not like complicated technology, thus we gave up needless functions such as a 3.5mm AUX-in, NFC, microphone. And other buttons were also abandoned apart from just one, with an LED indicator.

This is the EWA A106Pro, an unparalleled Mini Portable Bluetooth Speaker.

We hope people love it and take it everywhere with them.

We want you to know:

The product's maximum volume is 110dBa cellphone for 55dB), it's sounds more close to mid-high range.

This product is supposed to use in low-noise space. Not for party. Not for audiophile.

Simple, but packs a lot of punch.

Play it loud!

Thanks to the fully equipped custom-made high performance 3W neodymium driver, the EWA A106Pro is loud with well-balanced sound, louder than most of speakers which same its size.

Play it easy.

The only button on the speaker is the ON/ OFF button with LED indicator, which is also able to play/pause with 1X click, play the next track with 2 clicks and play the previous track with 3 clicks.

Do you noticed?

  • Loud and easily to fill any room space.
  • Delivers comfortable bass.
  • Well balanced sound.
  • Easy to use, even on the go.


Wireless Connection

Bluetooth Versions 5.0

  • The latest Bluetooth technology
  • Delivers an ultra-stable connection
  • Stable connection up to 30 ft away


State of the Art Craftsmanship

We pushed the limits in the creation of A106Pro, leveraging unique manufacturing innovations to craft a speaker that delivers premium sound quality in a sleek and versatile body.


Ready For Travel

The A106Pro is so tiny that you can just slide it in to your hand bag or even pocket.

With the packed original travel case, you can also hang it to your bag, bike or any other where.

Always ready to go.

      Usually speakers this small do not sound good. I own 3 bluetooth speakers of varying sizes bought over 9 years. The EWA speaker sounds very good for its tiny size. It has decent bass and hits the mid-range and high notes with great clarity. This thing is small enough to... See more
      Usually speakers this small do not sound good. I own 3 bluetooth speakers of varying sizes bought over 9 years. The EWA speaker sounds very good for its tiny size. It has decent bass and hits the mid-range and high notes with great clarity. This thing is small enough to easily fit in my pocket, purse, beach bag or even in the cupholder in a car. You can feel the little speaker pulsing with the beats. While something this tiny will never have as much deep bass as much larger, dual speaker cone models, this is a winner for size and ease of use.

      It appears to be well-made, came very nicely packaged with a short usb-c charging cable (same as my phone so very convenient on the go) and it's really simple to use - just one button does it all and since that button lights up - it's really easy to use at night. My other small bluetooth speaker has tiny buttons you can't see in the dark and are hard to touch because they are under the housing a bit. The weight of this EWA speaker makes it feel like a quality device. Pairing was quick and easy with my Galaxy S21+. The travel case and ring that came packaged with it are really nice to have so you can clip this to a backpack, bike, your beltloop or hang it on a tree, beach umbrella or whatever.

      All-around impressive little speaker for the price and size. I purchased this for use on vacation so I was looking for something that was waterproof and small enough to pack in my electronics gear case with my cords and chargers.

      Bonus bit of info - if you have a USB-C to USB-C phone cable, you can charge this little speaker right from your phone for extended play time. You can also play it while it's connected by USB to your phone for charging. Playback only works if the speaker has some charge on it first - if it's totally dead, allow about 15 minutes of charging to happen before playing to it while charging with your phone. The speaker has a 700 mAh battery so it only takes about 2 hours to charge from zero, but if playing while it's charging that charge time will be a bit longer - in my test it took 2.5 hours to charge while being used.

    • James
      5.0 out of 5 starsVerified Purchase
      A Pocket-Sized Powerhouse: EWA A106Pro Review
      Reviewed in the United States on February 8, 2025
      Color: Black
      If an egg could drop the bass, it would be the EWA A106Pro. This little speaker is so small, you might mistake it for a stress balluntil you turn it on and realize it has more energy than your morning espresso. The Good Stuff: Shockingly Loud For... See more
      If an egg could drop the bass, it would be the EWA A106Pro. This little speaker is so small, you might mistake it for a stress balluntil you turn it on and realize it has more energy than your morning espresso.

      The Good Stuff:

      Shockingly Loud For something barely bigger than a golf ball, this thing booms. It easily fills a room, making you wonder if its powered by some kind of dark magic.

      Surprisingly Good Bass Does it shake the walls? No. But for its size, the passive radiator delivers a satisfying thump that makes it feel like a real speaker, not just a tinny afterthought.

      Simple & Stylish No unnecessary buttons, no confusing featuresjust one sleek metal body with a single button. Even your technology-challenged relative could figure this out.

      Perfect for Travel Comes with a protective case, a carabiner for easy hanging, and fits in your pocket. Whether youre hiking, biking, or just avoiding human interaction, this speaker is ready to go.

      Waterproof & Durable Accidentally drop it in water? No worries. Its IP67 rated, so it can handle a splash (just let it dry before charging unless you like living dangerously).

      Battery Life that Lasts Up to 8 hours of playtime means itll probably outlast your party energy.

      The Not-So-Bad Stuff:

      No Mic, No Frills This is strictly a play music and shut up kind of speaker. No aux input, no voice assistant, no built-in speakerphone. But hey, at least it wont butt-dial your boss.

      Not for Audiophiles If youre expecting studio-quality sound from an $20 speaker the size of a Clementine, you might also believe in unicorns. But for everyday use? Fantastic.

      Final Verdict:

      For the price of a couple of fancy coffees, the EWA A106Pro delivers impressive sound, portability, and durability. Its proof that good things really do come in small (and budget-friendly) packages. If you need a tiny speaker that punches way above its weight, grab this one. Just dont be surprised when it scares your cat the first time you crank it up.

    • Amazon Customer
      5.0 out of 5 starsVerified Purchase
      Solid, tiny, attractive, competitively priced, sounds great. Ugly case.
      Reviewed in Canada on March 11, 2021
      Given the size constraints and relatively low price, the sound quality is excellent: rich, clear, well-balanced, and relatively distortion-free. You're not going to get hifi or booming bass from something this size or price, but it does a much better job of reproducing... See more
      Given the size constraints and relatively low price, the sound quality is excellent: rich, clear, well-balanced, and relatively distortion-free. You're not going to get hifi or booming bass from something this size or price, but it does a much better job of reproducing a full sound spectrum than anything else I've ever owned of a similar size. It can push out quite a decent volume too, so you *could* use it in a big or crowded space, but the limitations begin to show when you crank it up: it works, it doesn't sound awful, but it doesn't sound great. It's much better at a medium volume, where you get the full benefit of the dynamic range. The device itself looks great - minimalist in a good way, with nice proportions and no unnecessary frills. It is reassuringly heavy, and seems very solidly built. In a perfect world I would prefer that it had an auxillary physical connection, but the bluetooth works well, with low latency, and it connects easily with everything I've tried so far (Chromebook, Mac, Linux, Windows, Android, and iOS devices all work well). With just one button it's really simple to use, relying for almost everything else on the sending device. A click pauses/unpauses the sound, a long press turns it on or off: that's it. The button light changes colour in intuitive ways to indicate connection and charging. It makes a pleasant, quiet sound to indicate when it is on, unlike many others I've owned that beep or speak to you. I've not tested the water resistance yet, but that's a very useful feature: one of the big reasons I got this was to support a super-tough but weedy-sounding Chromebook that I like to take camping in rainy BC. The battery lasts forever (ish) and charges fairly quickly. It continues to work while charging. The speaker looks and feels like it should be indestructible so it almost encourages rough treatment. However, that's probably a very bad idea. The downward-facing passive woofer (too big a word for such a tiny thing - more of a yelper) is fully exposed so, if dropped or placed on something that pressed into it, I doubt that it would last long. It is recessed so, as long as it is always placed on a flat surface, this is unlikely to be a problem in normal use. I would recommend keeping it in the included very protective, well-made case but, unfortunately, that is a garish and slightly vomit-inducing shade of green, which really jars with the aesthetics of the device itself. It also adds considerably to the size. For camping and hiking, though, it will do.
